posts.post_content:
like most of the other scavenging creatures. WOTC must screw him grossly in at least one way.  
too much mana to cast ([sewer shambler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sewer shambler)), too much mana for scavenging ([drudge beetle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=drudge beetle),[korozda monitor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=korozda monitor)), or both of them ([terrus wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=terrus wurm) for example).  
  
in the other hand, this card can work nicely combined with [jarad's orders](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=jarad's orders)
posts.html:
like most of the other scavenging creatures. WOTC must screw him grossly in at least one way.
too much mana to cast (sewer shambler), too much mana for scavenging (drudge beetle,korozda monitor), or both of them (terrus wurm for example).

in the other hand, this card can work nicely combined with jarad's orders

Posted By: LordOfTheFlies87 (9/27/2012 9:32:15 PM)

posts.post_content: I really like this card. It has a decent 3/3 body, it has evasion. The way I play, 6 mana is never a problem, because I can delay my opponent for that long. If my opponent doesn't find a solution to the flying soon enough, they'd get mauled. If they do, I can still slap 3 +1/+1 counters onto another creature, preferably another evasive creature, for a beatdown.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Seriously people? 1.5? Is there NO imagination!?  
Run in a black/white angel deck. Use the Scavenge effect to feed [Herald of War](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Herald of War) and ALL your angels are 3 mana cheaper. All of them... for 4 mana.... :facepalm:  
There're plenty of red and black cards that are great fro discarding things like this to the graveyard so you don't have to summon it first. Is is grade-A awesome sauce? No. But can it have excellent potential for its scavenge effect? Hell yeah.  
3.4
